data.title: Classes to Learn Adobe Creative Suite
data.meta_description: Visual Persuasion FAQs providing training classes to learn adobe creative suite software near your location by experienced industry professionals in Denver.
data.meta_site_name: Denver Adobe Software Classes | Small Classes/Mighty Results
data.text:
This is the question we get asked most often. You have specific projects in mind, but you’re not quite sure what Adobe application will be best suited to tackle them. We’ll give you a simple breakdown of the programs and the types of projects you can expect to do in each application. If you want to discuss your situation with one of our Adobe experts, please call us toll free at 303.941.1727 or send us your question/s on our Contact Page. Get a response the same day!

Adobe Illustrator is a vector drawing program. Vector graphics are a powerful thing—imagine that you can take your artwork that is the size of a postage stamp and enlarge it the size of a billboard and the graphics look as crisp and clear as they did at the smaller size. Amazing, right? Illustrator is a program full of different types of drawing tools, brushes and many illustration time-savers. Illustrator can be used for (but is not limited to) symbol design, illustrations, maps, logos, patterns, fashion design, product illustration, technical illustration, medical illustration and most any type of print design…the possibilities are endless!

Adobe Photoshop is a premier digital imaging software. This program provides tools that will let you edit and manipulate images as well as create realistic painting effects. Photoshop can be used for (but not limited to) image editing, manipulating images, digital paintings and web design.

Adobe InDesign is the perfect program for creating print layouts…and now InDesign is great for digital layouts as well. InDesign provides many tools that makes it easy to control the layout of your page, manage long documents, make changes and control the consistency of multi-page documents and so much more! InDesign can be used for (but is not limited to) flyers, brochures, catalogs, book layout, magazines, interactive documents, epub files for digital eReaders and tablets, any type of print design.

Adobe Dreamweaver is included with some of the Adobe Creative Suite packages and is primarily used for designing web sites via HTML and CSS and supports many of the web development server languages such as PHP and ASP. Dreamweaver is the industry-leading web design software and has both a visual and coding interfaces so designers and developers at all levels can use it.

Adobe After Effects is included with some of the Adobe Creative Suite packages and is primarily used for creating motion graphics and visual effects. This particular software is popular in the following fields: videography, graphic design, website design, animation, video production, art direction, filmmaking, broadcasting, multimedia direction, VFX and 3D animation.
